interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Sausage Party
Review Date: 2018/09/30
Store: Conrad Vernon  (Director, Producer),     Greg Tiernan  (Director)    Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
Product Description: ['In this CG-animated movie, one sausage leads a group of supermarket products on a quest to discover the truth about their existence and what really happens when they become chosen to leave the grocery store. The film features the vocal talents of some of today’s best comedy stars – Seth Rogen, Kristen Wiig, Jonah Hill, Bill Hader, Michael Cera, James Franco, Danny McBride, Craig Robinson, Paul Rudd, Nick Kroll, David Krumholtz, Edward Norton, and Salma Hayek.']
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Dolby, NTSC, AC-3, Widescreen, Dubbed, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Evan Goldberg, Greg Tiernan, Great Beyond, LLC, Megan Ellison, Seth Rogen, Conrad Vernon', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 29 minutes', 'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'December 31, 2019', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.3 x 7.5 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': '43382325', 'Director': 'Conrad Vernon, Greg Tiernan', 'Media Format': 'Dolby, NTSC, AC-3, Widescreen, Dubbed, Subtitled', 'Run time': '1 hour and 29 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 8, 2016', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, English, French', 'Producers': 'Conrad Vernon, Evan Goldberg, Megan Ellison, Seth Rogen', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Stupid. Its pretty foul but mostly stupid I don't mind foul language and stuff like that but it was kinda like they were trying to hard to be explicit. Wasn't as funny as I thought it would be.
Review Title: ABSOLUTELY NOT FOR MINORS
Rating: 1.0
--------------------------------------------------

The Fate of the Furious
Vin Diesel  (Actor, Producer),     Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson  (Actor),     F. Gary Gray  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Action & Adventure
["Now that Dominic Toretto (Vin Diesel) and Letty Ortiz (Michelle Rodriguez) are on their honeymoon, and Brian (Paul Walker) and Mia (Jordana Brewster) have retired from the game, and the rest of the crew has been exonerated, the globetrotting team has found a semblance of a normal life. But when a mysterious woman seduces Dom into the world of crime he can't seem to escape, and a betrayal of those closest to him, they will face trials that will test them as never before. From the shores of Cuba and the streets of New York City to the icy plains off the arctic Barents Sea, the elite force will crisscross the globe to stop an anarchist from unleashing chaos on the world's stage, and to bring home the man who made them a family. —harpreet phamber"]

Trolls DHD
Kendrick, Anna  (Actor),     Timberlake, Justin  (Actor)    Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Movies
["From the creators of Shrek comes the most smart, funny, irreverent animated comedy of the year, DreamWorks' Trolls. This holiday season, enter a colorful, wondrous world populated by hilariously unforgettable characters and discover the story of the overly optimistic Trolls, with a constant song on their lips, and the comically pessimistic Bergens, who are only happy when they have trolls in their stomach. Featuring original music from Justin Timberlake, and soon-to-be classic mash-ups of songs from other popular artists, the film stars the voice talents of Anna Kendrick, Justin Timberlake, Russell Brand, James Corden, Kunal Nayyar, Ron Funches, Icona Pop, Gwen Stefani, and many more. DreamWorks' TROLLS is a fresh, broad comedy filled with music, heart and hair-raising adventures. In November of 2016, nothing can prepare you for our new Troll world."]

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user maintains a strong interest in classic movies from the 1980s and 1990s while expanding their repertoire to include contemporary genres such as animated films. They appreciate nostalgia-driven content and are embracing more family-friendly animated features, although they remain open to a variety of genres.

- **Genre Interest:** The user enjoys classic films, music-related content, animated comedies, and continues to show a preference for action and adventure narratives. However, their recent feedback indicates a more discerning approach to adult-themed content.

- **Format Choice:** The user prefers DVDs for their collectible nature and additional features, remaining committed to physical media.

- **Review Style:** The user typically offers succinct, highly positive feedback. However, their latest review reflects a significant deviation, demonstrating a willingness to critically assess content that does not meet their expectations, particularly regarding adult humor.

- **Actor Affinity:** The user appreciates films featuring recognizable talent, including popular voices in animated films, indicating an enthusiasm for well-known actors across various genres.

- **Family-Friendly Content:** Although the user enjoys family-friendly options, their recent interaction suggests a more cautious approach to content, as evidenced by a strong warning against adult-rated films for younger viewers.

Overall, the user’s preferences highlight a blend of classic nostalgia, a growing appreciation for animated films, a commitment to physical media, a history of positive feedback, and a renewed caution toward family-friendly viewing as they navigate more explicit content.
